verses.roman:
śuni' gopīnātha-mukunda duṅhe duḥkhā hailā
gopīnāthācārya kichu kahite lāgilā

synonyms: śuni'-hearing; gopīnātha-mukunda—Gopīnātha Ācārya and Mukunda Datta; duṅhe—both; duḥkhā—unhappy; hailā—became; gopīnātha-ācārya—of the name Gopīnātha Ācārya; kichu—something; kahite—to speak; lāgilā—began.
translation: Gopīnātha Ācārya and Mukunda Datta became very unhappy when they heard this. Gopīnātha Ācārya therefore addressed Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya as follows.
